title: Drawing, "Design for a Trophy Vase", ca. 1920–40
medium: Pen and black ink, red ink, red color pencil, graphite on cream tracing paper
markings: Stamp: in black ink at upper right: 228
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink at lower center: VASE/TROPHEE/DIAMETRE 15 cms (SANS ANSES)/HAUTEUR 22 cms 1/2; at lower right: JEAN PUIFORCAT/42
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description:
Cup-shaped trophy drawn in plan and elevation. The tapering body with a trapezoidal-shaped rosewood base suspended at the top by two circular handles within a U-shaped frame indicated in red ink and red color pencil. The frame decorated on each side with two single applied bands, raised on a tall cylindrical base, decorated at the foot rim with two applied bands. Underdrawing in graphite of the trophy in golden section.
Puiforcat Fabrication #: 228
